head.supplied: ¶ Account for Travelling Expenses, incurred by Mr J. Minchin, Second Herbarium Assistant, while collecting plants for the Botanic Museum on the Lower Murray River, submitted for the favorable conside...

div.p: J87/9733, unit 289, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M.
Account for Travelling Expenses, incurred by Mr J. Minchin, Second Herbarium Assistant, while collecting plants for the Botanic Museum on the Lower Murray River, submitted for the favorable consideration of the Honorable the Chief Secretary
H. Moors, for the Under Secretary, informed M that the account had been 'approved by the Minister', to which M replied 'with best thanks' on 24 October 1887. See also M to A. Deakin, 28 September 1887.
